greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sequence a_k of column k shifts left when Weigh transform is applied k times with a_k(n) = n for n<2; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
M. Bernstein and N. J. A. Sloane, Some canonical sequences of integers, Linear Alg. Applications, 226-228 (1995), 57-72; erratum 320 (2000), 210. [Link to arXiv version]

M. Bernstein and N. J. A. Sloane, Some canonical sequences of integers, Linear Alg. Applications, 226-228 (1995), 57-72; erratum 320 (2000), 210. [Link to Lin. Alg. Applic. version together with omitted figures]
maple: wtr:= proc(p) local b; b:= proc(n, i) option remember;
g:= proc(k) option remember; local b, t; b[0]:= j->
`if`(j<2, j, b[k](j-1)); for t to k do
mathematica: wtr[p_] := Module[{b}, b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = If[n == 0, 1, If[i < 1, 0, Sum[Binomial[p[i], j]*b[n - i*j, i - 1], {j, 0, n/i}]]]; b[#, #]&];
Table[A[n, d-n], {d, 0, 14}, {n, 0, d}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 10 2018, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Rows include (offsets may differ): A000004, A000012, A000027, A000217, A134465.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jun 24 2018
